Tender.definition: an act or instance of tendering b

1 a.definition: to make a tender of [ goods] [ delivery] [ payment] [ performance]

sub_terms.b: to offer as an amount in settlement of a claim by an injured party against an insured

1 a.note: An insurance company might be obligated to tender the limits of a policy to an injured party when a higher amount is likely to be awarded at trial.

2.definition: to extend for acceptance or consideration (as in proof of something) esp. in a proceeding [ a plea to the court] [ an issue]

3.definition: to offer for sale [ shares]to offer securities for sale [make an informed decision to ]
